intro: Phrynium tetranthum, commonly known as the four-flowered arrowleaf, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant features a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the genus Phrynium. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and botanical collections.
